title: Blind SQL injection in third-party software, that allows to reveal user statistic from rocket.chat and possibly hack into the rocketchat.agilecrm.com

profile.name: Rocket.Chat
profile.about: Rocket.Chat is a company built on open source values and a love for efficiency. The company is driven by our amazing community of contributors.

vulnerability_information:
Hi. I decided to go to static website https://rocket.chat/ and look what is there. I found third-party website request `https://stats2.agilecrm.com/addstats?callback=json9064172181954295&guid=5d659e65-2870-63d3-eff0-654315dd3b91&sid=515241ff-64f3-5589-f595-bf1bcccc56f9&url=https%3A%2F%2Frocket.chat%2F&agile=8pat9ou8gh0thqd8dlgctje3go&domain=dorgam` that loading on the main page. After "lite" parameters fussing I found out that parameter "new" is vulnerable to Blind SQL injection vulnerability.
**PoC:**
https://stats2.agilecrm.com/addstats?callback=json949659033379064&guid=f0d3738c-44c0-60a6-44b6-56e14ca30872&sid=2172c2ca-15b6-49c8-052d-b7d817cd280b&url=https%3A%2F%2Frocket.chat%2F&agile=8pat9ou8gh0thqd8dlgctje3go&new=(select*from(select(sleep(5)))a)&ref=&domain=dorgam

**Result:**
5 seconds of loading.

To show the vulnerability threat I decided to exploit it a bit:

Database version: MySQL 5.0.12
Server hostname: localhost
Databases: information_schema; mysql; performance_schema; stats
Stats: 3; persons; map.

## Suggested mitigation

Try to contact agilecrm support / developers and tell them about vulnerability and fix needing.

P.S: I know that on BB main page you letting researchers know about exclusions:
`Exclusions
While researching, we'd like to ask you to refrain from:
Static website (https://rocket.chat)`
But because of vulnerability severity I think I must let you know anyway.

## Impact

Vuln allows to reveal user statistic information from rocket.chat and possibly hack into rocketchat.agilecrm.com (if attacker decided to go deeper).

Hi. I decided to go to static website https://rocket.chat/ and look what is there. I found third-party website request https://stats2.agilecrm.com/addstats?callback=json9064172181954295&guid=5d659e65-2870-63d3-eff0-654315dd3b91&sid=515241ff-64f3-5589-f595-bf1bcccc56f9&url=https%3A%2F%2Frocket.chat%2F&agile=8pat9ou8gh0thqd8dlgctje3go&domain=dorgam that loading on the main page. After "lite" parameters fussing I found out that parameter "new" is vulnerable to Blind SQL injection vulnerability.
PoC:
https://stats2.agilecrm.com/addstats?callback=json949659033379064&guid=f0d3738c-44c0-60a6-44b6-56e14ca30872&sid=2172c2ca-15b6-49c8-052d-b7d817cd280b&url=https%3A%2F%2Frocket.chat%2F&agile=8pat9ou8gh0thqd8dlgctje3go&new=(select*from(select(sleep(5)))a)&ref=&domain=dorgam

Result:
5 seconds of loading.

To show the vulnerability threat I decided to exploit it a bit:

Database version: MySQL 5.0.12
Server hostname: localhost
Databases: information_schema; mysql; performance_schema; stats
Stats: 3; persons; map.

Suggested mitigation

Try to contact agilecrm support / developers and tell them about vulnerability and fix needing.

P.S: I know that on BB main page you letting researchers know about exclusions:
Exclusions
While researching, we'd like to ask you to refrain from:
Static website (https://rocket.chat)
But because of vulnerability severity I think I must let you know anyway.

Impact

Vuln allows to reveal user statistic information from rocket.chat and possibly hack into rocketchat.agilecrm.com (if attacker decided to go deeper).

activities.message: We have submitted the report to AgileCRM team and they are looking into it. Meanwhile, we are already planning to move to another CRM this month.
activities.markdown_message: We have submitted the report to AgileCRM team and they are looking into it. Meanwhile, we are already planning to move to another CRM this month.

activities.message: Hmm, looking into dangerous SQLi for 2,5 months? Interesting. Did they answer smth, relating to this bug?
activities.markdown_message: Hmm, looking into dangerous SQLi for 2,5 months? Interesting. Did they answer smth, relating to this bug?

activities.message:
They have *finally* responded, saying they have fixed the issue.
Here's their answer:

```
Rabinder Madugula

Apr 11, 1:51 PM (GMT)

Hello Marcelo, 

I hope you are are doing well. 

I am writing to let you know that Agile CRM's Security Vulnerability issue that was reported has been resolved by our Product development team. 

We request you kindly check the same and let us know your feedback. 

Thank you for your valuable time and continued patience. Looking forward to hearing from you. 

Regards,

Rabinder 
Agile CRM - www.agilecrm.com 
Phone: +1.800.980.0729

How would you rate the support received?
```
activities.markdown_message:
They have finally responded, saying they have fixed the issue.
Here's their answer:

Rabinder Madugula

Apr 11, 1:51 PM (GMT)

Hello Marcelo, 

I hope you are are doing well. 

I am writing to let you know that Agile CRM's Security Vulnerability issue that was reported has been resolved by our Product development team. 

We request you kindly check the same and let us know your feedback. 

Thank you for your valuable time and continued patience. Looking forward to hearing from you. 

Regards,

Rabinder 
Agile CRM - www.agilecrm.com 
Phone: +1.800.980.0729

How would you rate the support received?

activities.message:
Hi @w2w

I think this shouldnt be disclosed through our program. The vulnerability was part of AgileCRM which we switched out, also we excluded our static website from our program scope.

Still we appreciate a lot your report of this vulnerability. It is just not a vulnerability of Rocket.Chat.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @w2w

I think this shouldnt be disclosed through our program. The vulnerability was part of AgileCRM which we switched out, also we excluded our static website from our program scope.

Still we appreciate a lot your report of this vulnerability. It is just not a vulnerability of Rocket.Chat.

activities.message: Hello @markus-rocketchat, your main argument to not disclosure this bug is that the bug from Agile CRM, not Rocket.Chat. Since the bug was fixed from the Agile side, could you please ask Agile developers whether they are agreed to disclosure or not? This is a pretty interesting vulnerability in third-party analytics that shows the importance of checking third-party requests/scripts on the website. I think other researchers would like to look at this report and some of them probably will review their vulnerability search techniques in the result of this report, which will change the bug bounty/infosec for the better.
activities.markdown_message: Hello @markus-rocketchat, your main argument to not disclosure this bug is that the bug from Agile CRM, not Rocket.Chat. activities.message:
Hi @w2w 

the report has been disclosed. AgileCRM did not respond yet, but in any case: this does not diminish the fact that you helped fixing a critical issue. Thanks for that!
